intro: Ledonia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ledonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves that are often bluish-green in color. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ledonia hirsuta is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
